items.longDescription:
Lisa Larson

Lisa Larson's warm touch and humorous, cute animal motifs, much loved by fans around the world, are now incorporated into these new designs in calm and gentle colors.

Lisa Larson
Lisa Larson is a Swedish ceramist with many fans worldwide. Larson joined Gustavsberg Factory, a leading Swedish ceramic manufacturer, where for over twenty years, she worked as a designer, producing several hundred pieces of work. In 1980, Larson left Gustavsberg Factory to work independently. In 1992, she established Keramikstudion Gustavsberg, where she continues to create new works to this day.

© Lisa & Johanna Larson
items.name: Lisa Larson Lounge Set (Short Sleeve)
items.shortDescription: Lisa Larson is a popular Scandinavian artist. Some of her adorable animals are back in Uniqlo this season.

items.longDescription:
Mickey & Friends Art by Steven Harrington

Steven Harrington is an artist living in Los Angeles, USA. These UT original designs colorfully depict Disney characters from a unique perspective through his richly imaginative magic.

Steven Harrington
Based in Los Angeles California, artist and designer Steven Harrington has produced a variety of works ranging from fine art painting to collaborations with commercial clients. Harrington has held exhibitions in major cities throughout the world, including America, Europe and Asia. Using custom-mixed paints, all originally formulated, Harrington reflects the sunny days and mystical atmosphere of Los Angeles.

The collection's title, "Mickey & Friends," is decorated with bits of characters and various image motifs. Steven Harrington's unique color palette, based on pastel tones, adorns the pop artwork that symbolizes this collection. Matching designs are also available in our Kids' collection.

©Disney
items.name: Mickey & Friends UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Colorful drawings of Mickey Mouse and his friends by LA-based artist Steven Harrington, now in UT!

items.longDescription:
Museums of The World Collection

The partnership between UNIQLO and the museums is aimed at providing more people with opportunities to experience art by offering free admission programs and launching collaboration products, among other initiatives. This is a special collection that showcases the unique identity of each partnered museum by incorporating the exterior of the museum into the design.

The design features the distinctive Tate Modern building, which was originally a power station, expressed using the dotted style of the official logo. The text, in Tate Modern's own font, includes the museum's name and location.

© Tate 2022
items.name: Museumsoftheworld UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Introducing a new UT lineup featuring some of the world's finest art museums partnered with UNIQLO.
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean

New York weekend trip

If you ask a New Yorker where they like to go for a weekend getaway you will get many answers. Some go surfing or hiking. Some on a trek to visit a flea market. Some just want to drive upstate and discover new cafes and shops.

- It can be worn as a set-up with shorts, and the material is made of a solid, thick fabric for a more casual look.

items.shortDescription: New Yorkers often take weekend trips to rest and recharge from city life. We were inspired by this concept for UT.

items.longDescription:
NYC POP ICONS

Keith Haring, Jean-Michel Basquiat and Kenny Scharf pioneered the pop culture of New York City in the 1980s. The artists helped establish New York as the center of pop culture in the 80s and made the city more vibrant.

Artist, Kenny Scharf
Born in 1958 in California, USA. Kenny Scharf came to prominence in New York City’s East Village art scene in the 1980s and connected popular culture and art through commercial projects. His work is consistently characterized as pop, surrealist, imaginative, and environmentally minded. He still has a prolific art practice and vibrant following around the world.

© Kenny Scharf. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: Nyc Pop Icons UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Iconic works by Keith Haring, Jean-Michel Basquiat, and Kenny Scharf, pioneers of 1980s New York pop culture, are now available at UT.
items.washingInformation: Machine wash cold, Do not Dry Clean

items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.
items.longDescription:
NYC POP ICONS

Keith Haring, Jean-Michel Basquiat and Kenny Scharf pioneered the pop culture of New York City in the 1980s. The artists helped establish New York as the center of pop culture in the 80s and made the city more vibrant.

Jean-Michel Basquiat
An icon of New York in the 1980s, Jean-Michel Basquiat became renowned during his short career for works inspired by his early street art and a distinctive iconography often connected to art history. His paintings, drawings, and prints drew on a diverse range of sources, from African, Aztec, and Greek cultures to Americana in the form of jazz, baseball, and social and political events.

© Estate of Jean-Michel Basquiat. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: Nyc Pop Icons UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Iconic works by Keith Haring, Jean-Michel Basquiat, and Kenny Scharf, pioneers of 1980s New York pop culture, are now available at UT.

items.longDescription:
NYC POP ICONS

Keith Haring, Jean-Michel Basquiat and Kenny Scharf pioneered the pop culture of New York City in the 1980s. The artists helped establish New York as the center of pop culture in the 80s and made the city more vibrant.

Keith Haring
A key figure in New York’s East Village scene in the late 1970s and 80s, American artist Keith Haring’s artwork populated not only art galleries, but also the city’s subways, streets, and sidewalks. His work often combined an iconographic vocabulary, including hearts, flying saucers, winged figures, and a crawling “radiant baby,”with abstract marks and patterning.

© Keith Haring Foundation. Licensed by Artestar, New York.
items.name: Nyc Pop Icons UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: Iconic works by Keith Haring, Jean-Michel Basquiat, and Kenny Scharf, pioneers of 1980s New York pop culture, are now available at UT.

items.freeInformation: - The images shown may include colors that are not available.
items.longDescription:
Saul Leiter

Saul Leiter began taking color photographs in the 1940s, when black-and-white photography was the norm. This collaboration includes a special photo T-shirt collection featuring a selection of his early signature photos that capture the mystical beauty of everyday life from unique angles, juxtaposed with some of his quotes.

Saul Leiter
Saul Leiter is a legendary photographer who spent most of his life in New York City. His work appeared in well-known fashion magazines in the 1950s and 1960s, but he stepped away from the front line in the 1980s. His photo collection Early Color was released in 2006, when he was 82 years old, and was a major hit as he rose to prominence as a pioneer of color photography. Retrospectives and publications featuring Saul Leiter continue to be presented around the world, and a documentary film was released in 2013. Saul Leiter passed away in 2013. Iconic works from his vast collection of approximately 80,000 photographs have been carefully selected for his first apparel collaboration in the world, with UT.

Taxi, 1957

©Saul Leiter Foundation
items.name: Saul Leiter UT (Short Sleeve Graphic T-Shirt)
items.shortDescription: The streets of New York as captured by Saul Leiter, the pioneer of color photography, are now available in our UT lineup.

Born in Tokyo in 1984. Moved to the United States in 2007, and currently based in Brooklyn. Meguru Yamaguchi focuses on brushstroke techniques, which have been a quintessential element of painting through times, and he expresses them out of canvas limitations, letting brushstrokes exist solely in space. His signature series “OUT OF BOUNDS” is further explored by the artist recently, to work on his first three-dimensional sculpture series to visualize energies of the self, nature and environment, the earth or the sun.

©Meguru Yamaguchi

items.longDescription:
PEANUTS × Reyn Spooner

Sunbaked in the spirit of Aloha, Reyn Spooner has been crafting quality Aloha Shirts for over 65 years. Founded on the beach of Waikiki, Reyn Spooner is known globally for their original Aloha prints and exceptional products. For this print, Reyn Spooner’s talented artists have taken Charles M. Schulz’s original characters and infused some Aloha as Charlie Brown and the Peanuts gang can be seen enjoying Hawaii.

A bold print on the back shows Joe Cool and the Peanuts gang relaxing on a beach with palm trees and hibiscus flowers. The front features the text “HERE'S JOE COOL HANGING AROUND THE BEACH.”

©2022 Peanuts Worldwide LLC
©2022 reynspooner
